mainBoard.name: Canopy Spider
mainBoard.originalText: Canopy Spider can block creatures with flying.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

mainBoard.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

mainBoard.name: Lowland Basilisk
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever Lowland Basilisk damages any creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: If a creature leaves the battlefield before the end of combat, then the Lowland Basilisk effect on it will end.
If it damages a creature outside of combat, its effect will destroy the creature at the end of the next combat.

mainBoard.text: Whenever Lowland Basilisk deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

mainBoard.name: Tempting Licid
mainBoard.originalText:
o
G, oc
T: Tempting Licid loses ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so" instead of a creature. Move Tempting Licid onto target creature. You may pay o
G to end this effect.

rulings.text: If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid’s controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.
Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can’t be responded to.

mainBoard.text:
{G}, {T}: Tempting Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {G} to end this effect.
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

mainBoard.originalText: Kindle deals to target creature or player an amount of damage equal to 2 plus the number of Kindle cards in all graveyards.

mainBoard.name: Rampant Growth
mainBoard.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put it into play, tapped. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

mainBoard.name: Verdant Touch
mainBoard.originalText:
Buyback o3 (You may pay an additional o3 when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Target land becomes a 2/2 creature permanently. (This creature still counts as a land.)

rulings.text: The land is still a land and retains all its abilities, plus any other characteristics.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

mainBoard.text:

foreignData.name: Pulsierender Stein
foreignData.text: Die Kosten jeder Kreaturenfähigkeit, die Aktivierungskosten erfordert, wird um 1 reduziert. Dies kann die Kosten einer Fähigkeit an beliebigen Mana nicht unter 1 reduzieren.

mainBoard.name: Heartstone
mainBoard.originalText: The cost of each creature ability requiring an activation cost is reduced by o1. This cannot reduce an ability's generic mana cost to less then o1.

rulings.text: It will never reduce any colored mana portion of an activation cost.
It will not add a {1} to abilities with no generic mana in their activation cost.
The cost reduction can be applied to additional costs.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

mainBoard.text: Activated abilities of creatures cost {1} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the mana in that cost to less than one mana.
